metadata.synopsis: The druid Halsin appears at the player's camp and offers to help them find a cure for their tadpoles - a journey that will take them to a dangerous new region.(This dialog will play as a fallback Halsin is intended to join the player's camp in the event of a Grove lockdown or  if the player murders the grove/attack on den is auto-completed.)

163.speaker: Halsin
163.text: A fine camp you have here. Certainly an improvement on that filthy cage the goblins had me in.

222.speaker: Halsin
222.text: A fine camp you have here. My apologies for showing up unannounced.

97.speaker: Halsin
97.text: My thanks again, for all you did. With the grove safe, I am free to turn to other matters.

173.speaker: Halsin
173.text: I owe you a debt for seeing to the goblins' leaders. Now I'm here to pay that debt.

86.speaker: Halsin
86.text: I heard how you saved the grove; it wouldn't be right for me to let you leave without expressing my gratitude.

81.speaker: Halsin
81.text: I wish to come with you, help solve this problem that's plaguing you. It's the least I can do.

37.speaker: Halsin
37.text: The path is now clear - we have to get to Moonrise Towers. Do you remember what I told you? About getting there?

209.speaker: Player
209.text: I remember. To Moonrise Towers, then.

40.speaker: Halsin
40.text: Indeed, and may the Oak Father watch over us on our journey. We will speak soon, I'm sure.

125.speaker: Halsin
125.text: There is a terrible curse surrounding Moonrise Towers - a shadow curse that drains away all light and life.

93.speaker: Halsin
93.text: Few can resist it without dying or transforming into shadow beings. You can try to journey overland if you wish, but I strongly advise you go under.

20.speaker: Halsin
20.text: There is a tunnel leading from the temple of Selûne right down into the Underdark and beyond. The entrance is hidden somewhere in the ruins.

94.speaker: Halsin
94.text: I believe if you find this entrance, you'll discover a route that leads to Moonrise Towers, bypassing the worst of the shadow curse.

198.speaker: Halsin
198.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for the same entrance - they sought an artefact called the Nightsong that was supposed to be housed somewhere down there.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Seems it's high time we got on our way.

22.speaker: Halsin
22.text: I will join you, help you with that which plagues you. The illithid curse is a blight to all nature.

166.speaker: Halsin
166.text: There is hope... but it isn't found here, at my hands - at least not yet.

30.speaker: Halsin
30.text: There's a chokehold of magic, binding the creature to you. Any efforts to remove it would almost certainly kill you - or worse.

223.speaker: Player
223.text: You promised you'd do something about my infection.

172.speaker: Halsin
172.text: Patience. I can't just snap my fingers... but I know where the solution almost certainly lies - Moonrise Towers.

46.speaker: Halsin
46.text: It's the source of this magic, and where the cultists send their captives - to be infected. They're building an army. Innocents go in, True Souls come out.

245.speaker: Halsin
245.text: Find whoever's behind the parasites and the magic. If we can understand it, then perhaps we can cure it - provided you survive long enough.

132.speaker: Halsin
132.text: Luckily, you have time - this magic has slowed your ceremorphosis to a crawl. I just can't fathom why someone would do that.

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: At last, a cure is in reach. To the Towers, then, where the moonlight will lend way to a new dawn.

53.speaker: Wyll
53.text: At last, a cure is in reach. To the Towers, then, where the moonlight will lend way to a new dawn.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: These tadpoles obey one master. If the ghaik have united in a single Creed, my Queen is in danger.

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: Once we are cleansed, we infiltrate Moonrise Towers. Should there be ghaik, we snatch their heads, one by one.

146.speaker: Gale
146.text: This is sobering news indeed, but there's no use crying over spilt milk. If this is our only option, to Moonrise Towers we go.

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: We get a cure and the chance to hit these arseholes where they live? Sounds good to me.

72.speaker: Halsin
72.text: Moonrise Towers? What is that place?

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Moonrise Towers? What is that place?

119.speaker: Halsin
119.text: An ancient citadel, abandoned for years - and for very good reason - until these cultists took it over.

224.speaker: Halsin
224.text: Apart from facing legions of Absolute followers? The whole region is shrouded in a curse - a shadow curse.

242.speaker: Halsin
242.text: For years now, this curse has consumed all light and life. It spits out only darkness and despair.

35.speaker: Halsin
35.text: Few survive long - those who do are transformed by the curse. It is not a place to venture into lightly.

231.speaker: Player
231.text: There's no time to spare, then - to Moonrise Towers.

247.speaker: Halsin
247.text: Wait, please. There's more. The whole region around Moonrise is shrouded in a curse - a shadow curse.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Doesn't sound like I've much choice - I need to get to Moonrise, curse or not.

138.speaker: Halsin
138.text: You're half right - you have to get to Moonrise, but you still have a choice of how to get there.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: The Absolute's forces can tolerate such a place?

64.speaker: Halsin
64.text: So it seems, though I don't know how. You will have to choose your approach carefully.

88.speaker: Halsin
88.text: You could go overland - along the Risen Road or through the mountains. Easier at first, but you'll run into the shadow curse eventually.

18.speaker: Halsin
18.text: You could also go under. There is a tunnel somewhere in the ruined temple of Selûne. It leads to Moonrise Towers through the Underdark.

110.speaker: Halsin
110.text: Long ago, a man called Ketheric Thorm built a secret stronghold deep down there, before rallying a whole army of Dark Justiciars - Shar worshippers.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Dark Justiciars? I must see for myself.
153.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

15.speaker: Shadowheart
15.text: Dark Justiciars? I must see for myself.
15.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

219.speaker: Player
219.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for a way down there - they were promised riches if they retrieved a relic called the Nightsong. But I think there's more.
219.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

158.speaker: Halsin
158.text: Aradin and his lot were looking for a way down there - they were promised riches if they retrieved a relic called the Nightsong. But I think there's more.
158.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

179.speaker: Halsin
179.text: From this stronghold, Ketheric's forces could access both the temple of Selûne and Moonrise Towers - but he was defeated before he could launch an attack.
179.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

191.speaker: Halsin
191.text: If you can find this place, I'll wager it will reveal a path to Moonrise Towers, bypassing the worst of the shadow curse.
191.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I already found the place you're talking about - it's called Grymforge.
80.context: InternalNodeContext: This QN if the player has already entered the grymforge but has not yet spoken to Halsin about it.

244.speaker: Halsin
244.text: You've already been? Impressive. You'll make me redundant at this rate. What did you find?
244.context: NodeContext: Impressed and a little amused at the player's diligence (finding a place before he can even tell them about it)

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I found an elevator - but it leads right into the shadow curse.
38.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player clicked the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

211.speaker: Halsin
211.text: That sounds like what you need. But the next part of the journey mightn't be straightforward - or safe.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Absolute followers - but that's about all.
178.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player didn't click the elevator from Grymforge to SCL

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: Keep looking. If they're present, then it's likely there's a route to Moonrise somewhere.

246.speaker: Player
246.text: Danger. Are you sure that's the best way to Moonrise?
246.context: InternalNodeContext: GLO_Halsin_AcknowledgedGrymforge sets whenever the player enquires about the Grymforge and Halsin acknowledges how it may relate to the journey to Moonrise.

79.speaker: Halsin
79.text: I'm certain. The Underdark is dangerous, yes, but the alternative is suicide. Be patient and be thorough - the path will reveal itself in time.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: I've got more exploring to do.
199.context: InternalNodeContext: GLO_Halsin_AcknowledgedGrymforge sets whenever the player enquires about the Grymforge and Halsin acknowledges how it may relate to the journey to Moonrise.

39.speaker: Halsin
39.text: Tread carefully. You're on the right track, I'm sure - but there'll still be danger and difficulty before you reach Moonrise.
39.context: InternalNodeContext: GLO_Halsin_AcknowledgedGrymforge sets whenever the player enquires about the Grymforge and Halsin acknowledges how it may relate to the journey to Moonrise.

217.speaker: Halsin
217.text: It may prove impossible to avoid the shadow curse entirely, but if you find any way to limit your exposure, seize it.
217.context: InternalNodeContext: GLO_Halsin_AcknowledgedGrymforge sets whenever the player enquires about the Grymforge and Halsin acknowledges how it may relate to the journey to Moonrise.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I found the hidden entrance in the temple of Selûne - the way is clear.
36.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

185.speaker: Halsin
185.text: Already...? If only I'd gone with you instead of Aradin.

248.speaker: Player
248.text: I've already found a way into the Underdark. I can pick up the trail from there.
248.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

161.speaker: Player
161.text: So how do I find this underground route?
161.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

154.speaker: Halsin
154.text: You'll need to pick up where Aradin left off - find the hidden entrance. It's somewhere in the temple of Selûne.

202.speaker: Halsin
202.text: One of the adventurers had a clue to help find it - a dwarf called Brian. It might still be found on his corpse, wherever the goblins left it.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: I don't want to risk getting lost in the Underdark - I'll journey overland.
215.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

116.speaker: Halsin
116.text: You may reconsider once you see the effects of the curse for yourself.
116.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

55.speaker: Halsin
55.text: I would like to join your camp, if you'll allow me. I can offer my skills, my counsel.
55.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

137.speaker: Halsin
137.text: I've long sought to return to Moonrise Towers - unfinished business. It seems our fates have aligned.
137.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

210.speaker: Player
210.text: How do I find this passage through the Underdark?
210.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Say I decide to try this Underdark route after all - how do I get started?
1.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

194.speaker: Player
194.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: I advise you start in the temple of Selûne - if you find the Dark Justiciars' hidden entrance, it could lead you all the way to Moonrise.

238.speaker: Player
238.text: You want to go to Moonrise yourself? Why?
238.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

175.speaker: Halsin
175.text: Those illithid creatures threaten the natural order - it's my duty to do what I can to stop them.

7.speaker: Halsin
7.text: There's also the shadow curse - it's an affront and must be cleansed.

127.speaker: Halsin
127.text: I helped overthrow Ketheric Thorm and his Dark Justiciars years ago. But I failed to prevent him from unleashing darkness across the region before he was defeated.

151.speaker: Halsin
151.text: I spent years researching the curse, trying to put an end to it. Nothing has worked - yet.

237.speaker: Halsin
237.text: If I can join you and get close to Moonrise, perhaps I can lift this curse, same as you may find a cure for your infection.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: Is that why you went with Aradin? You thought he might find this route to Moonrise?
181.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

201.speaker: Halsin
201.text: Precisely. Then perhaps I could have done something about both the shadow curse and ceremorphosis aberrations.

43.speaker: Halsin
43.text: But in my eagerness, I put far too much faith in the abilities of Aradin and his band. We didn't even get close.

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: One of those who died had a clue that was supposed to help us find the hidden entrance to the Underdark.

160.speaker: Halsin
160.text: A dwarf called Brian, I believe. Though there's no guarantee that the goblins left him recognisable.

89.speaker: Player
89.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

32.speaker: Halsin
32.text: It's lost to me. Perhaps in time I can open it up to the world again, but for now, I must help you.
32.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

90.speaker: Halsin
90.text: I've chosen a successor as First Druid - Francesca of the High Forest. A bird's already been dispatched to summon her.
90.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

71.speaker: Player
71.text: First and only Druid. What will Francesca even do here?
71.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

41.speaker: Halsin
41.text: She can tend to the grove, help it heal. In time, others will join. Perhaps some day I can return.

184.speaker: Player
184.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

112.speaker: Halsin
112.text: A fellow druid. I can count on her to tend to the grove in my absence. Help it heal.
112.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

187.speaker: Halsin
187.text: Precisely! Who indeed? You do not know, and neither do any of the others.
187.context: NodeContext: Turning the player's question back on them - they've inadvertently stumbled upon the reasoning behind his decision

240.speaker: Player
240.text: There's nobody in the grove you'd choose?

206.speaker: Halsin
206.text: No. At least, not right now.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: What about one of the others? Rath, perhaps?

196.speaker: Halsin
196.text: Rath has promise, but he has a ways to go yet. He wasn't able to stop Kagha by himself. The grove needs experience and a strong hand.

63.speaker: Halsin
63.text: I need her to stay focused on her training - the grove will need a skilled healer in my absence.

19.speaker: Halsin
19.text: I'm glad you approve - I do not truly care if you approve, but I am glad.

140.speaker: Halsin
140.text: The grove needs to move beyond the mistakes of the past. What it needs is an unknown quantity; an outsider who can enforce the Oak Father's teachings without bias.

133.speaker: Halsin
133.text: This is why I chose Francesca. She will restore simplicity and purity to the grove in my absence.

189.speaker: Halsin
189.text: Contrary to how some think of us, we druids can play politics when necessary.

152.speaker: Halsin
152.text: Resentment will spring up like mushrooms no matter what I do. You cannot please everyone and you'd be a fool to try.

2.speaker: Halsin
2.text: Now, we've quite the journey ahead. Best get started.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Sounds like the grove will be in good hands, then. We should get going.

82.speaker: Halsin
82.text: Indeed. We've quite the journey ahead of us.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: You mentioned you had unfinished business in Moonrise Towers - what did you mean?

92.speaker: Player
92.text: I never thought I'd say this, but it sounds like the Underdark is the safer route.

134.speaker: Halsin
134.text: Anything is preferable to risking the shadow curse.

58.speaker: Halsin
58.text: The decision is yours, but I'd favour the Underdark. Even a place like that is the lesser evil compared to the shadow-cursed lands.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: This shadow curse - does it affect Shar worshippers?

203.speaker: Halsin
203.text: I don't know. Ketheric's followers were defeated or vanished before the effects of the curse took hold.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Are these Sharrans still to be found?

87.speaker: Halsin
87.text: As bones, perhaps. But their hidden structures might still remain.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: I know the Underdark - it's lethal. I'll travel overland.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: The Underdark's my home. Better to take that route than risk this curse.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: I'm sure there must be other ways to cure myself.

101.speaker: Halsin
101.text: By all means - pursue any leads you may have. But I sense all roads will lead to Moonrise, in the end.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: How are you so sure Moonrise is where I have to go?

77.speaker: Halsin
77.text: Nature speaks to me. Birds report what they've seen. And I've overheard goblins speaking of it, too. Moonrise is at the heart of all this, I'm sure of it.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I was expecting more from you than a lead towards some distant, dangerous prospect.

192.speaker: Halsin
192.text: I won't be held accountable just because you're naive enough to expect easy answers. Now allow me to continue.

216.speaker: Player
216.text: That's it? Just go to this place?

49.speaker: Halsin
49.text: What, were you expecting a spell? A potion? Or perhaps you thought I'd conduct a cack-handed operation on you right here.

234.speaker: Halsin
234.text: What were you expecting? That I'd mumble a spell or whip out a potion?

200.speaker: Astarion
200.text: Finally, we're catching up on our puppet master. And the hunt ends at Moonrise Towers.

109.speaker: Shadowheart
109.text: I suppose it was too much to hope we were going to be cured here and now. To Moonrise, then.

241.speaker: Player
241.text: That doesn't sound much like hope to me. Can't you just help here and now?

208.speaker: Player
208.text: This magic isn't typical of ceremorphosis?

213.speaker: Halsin
213.text: No, this is different. Altered. But I believe I know where answers can be found - Moonrise Towers.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: You learned all this from your studies?

186.speaker: Halsin
186.text: Indeed. After we dealt with the drow that ambushed us, Nettie and I were able to inspect the corpse - and the creature that slithered out of it.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: How do you know all this?

121.speaker: Halsin
121.text: A drow forced me to defend myself. Afterwards, I was able to study the parasite that slithered out of the corpse, see what drives these 'True Souls'.

122.speaker: Halsin
122.text: I had no idea anyone beyond their ranks was infected. You have my sincere sympathies.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: This magic you mentioned - it isn't normal for these parasites?

156.speaker: Halsin
156.text: I have nowhere else to turn, it seems. I went to the grove, but... I cannot face what has happened there.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

117.speaker: Halsin
117.text: It is sealed off to me, to the whole world. Forever, perhaps.

105.speaker: Halsin
105.text: If you hadn't seen to the leaders of that goblin horde, the grove would be no more. I am in your debt.

9.speaker: Halsin
9.text: I am Halsin, First Druid of the Emerald Grove - and I owe you my thanks.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

29.speaker: Halsin
29.text: If you hadn't killed the leaders of that goblin horde, the grove would be no more. I am in your debt.

75.speaker: Halsin
75.text: Don't worry, I'm not here just to sing your praises. I believe I can help - with your tadpole.

205.speaker: Halsin
205.text: I am Halsin, First Druid of the Emerald Grove - which you saved. Thank you.
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

165.speaker: Halsin
165.text: I am Halsin, First Druid of the Emerald Grove.
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

129.speaker: Halsin
129.text: Or I was, at least. I went there - the grove is sealed off to me, to the whole world.
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

227.speaker: Player
227.text: First Druid? You sound like someone who could help with a problem I have...
227.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

47.speaker: Halsin
47.text: I know. It's what brings me here.

120.speaker: Halsin
120.text: I sensed what was done to you from afar. Now let me confirm it; I need to know exactly what we're dealing with...

225.speaker: Player
225.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

100.speaker: Halsin
100.text: Thank you. I will grieve when I can, but for now, I must find another way to serve nature - by helping you.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Forget about the grove. What are you doing here?
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

228.speaker: Halsin
228.text: Looking for you, of course. We have work to do.
228.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

236.speaker: Halsin
236.text: I'm here for you. I believe I can help with the parasite lurking within.
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

239.speaker: Player
239.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

45.speaker: Halsin
45.text: All too well - I could even sense it from afar. Now let me confirm it; I need to know exactly what we're dealing with...
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

235.speaker: Narrator
235.text: Oak Father preserve you, child... You're infected, aren't you? The mind flayers' spawn.
235.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin raises a hand to your head, magically connecting with you (no contact). He gives an alarmed look - he knows what’s inside you

197.speaker: Halsin
197.text: Oak Father preserve you, child... You're infected, aren't you? The mind flayers' spawn.

56.speaker: Halsin
56.text: But... something's different. You're aware of the monster inside you. You don't bow to the Absolute, like the True Souls do...

150.speaker: Player
150.text: I escaped from an illithid ship after being infected. Maybe the process was interrupted.

5.speaker: Halsin
5.text: Perhaps... but I wouldn't want to place all my faith in blind luck.

162.speaker: Halsin
162.text: I was right to seek you out. You're after a cure for this parasite.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'm shielded from the worst of the parasite's magic.

128.speaker: Halsin
128.text: That sounds... novel. What is it that protects you?

233.speaker: Player
233.text: You can see that I have free will - you don't need to know any more than that.

26.speaker: Halsin
26.text: I'd still be target practice for goblins if you hadn't come along. I think I can trust you.

74.speaker: Halsin
74.text: And I may be able to help you find a more definitive solution to your problem.

73.speaker: Halsin
73.text: But I'm afraid it won't be easy, or quick.

148.speaker: Halsin
148.text: There's a chokehold of magic, binding the creature to you. Any efforts to remove it would almost certainly kill you - or worse.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: 'Almost'? That means I still have a chance. One I intend to take.

171.speaker: Halsin
171.text: Your resolve is most admirable. It'll serve you well for where you've to go - Moonrise Towers.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: That doesn't sound much like hope to me. Can't you help?

167.speaker: Halsin
167.text: Patience. I can't just snap my fingers... but I know where the solution almost certainly lies - Moonrise Towers.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: This magic isn't typical of ceremorphosis?

27.speaker: Halsin
27.text: No, this is different. Altered. But I believe I know where answers can be found - Moonrise Towers.

229.speaker: Halsin
229.text: That place is where the cultists send their captives. Innocents go in, True Souls come out. It has to be the source of this magic.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: And you think I'll find a cure if I find this source at Moonrise?

147.speaker: Halsin
147.text: Precisely. If we can understand just what this magic is, then perhaps we can rid you of this parasite.

164.speaker: Halsin
164.text: It's immensely powerful, whatever it is - strong enough to slow ceremorphosis to a crawl. Luckily, that gives you more time.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: That must be where the ship was taking me - before it crashed.

95.speaker: Halsin
95.text: Be glad it did, or you'd be a True Soul by now.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I wasn't taken to Moonrise - I was infected on a mind flayer ship, before it crashed.

13.speaker: Halsin
13.text: And where do you suppose that ship was taking you? Moonrise, I'll wager. The journey differs, but the problem is the same.

157.speaker: Halsin
157.text: If we can get to Moonrise and understand just what this magic is, then perhaps we can rid you of this parasite.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: You learned all this from your studies?

230.speaker: Halsin
230.text: Indeed. After we dealt with the drow that ambushed us, Nettie and I were able to inspect the corpse - and the creature that slithered out of it.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: How do you know all this?

54.speaker: Halsin
54.text: A drow forced me to defend myself. Afterwards, I was able to study the parasite that slithered out of the corpse, see what drives these 'True Souls'.

6.speaker: Halsin
6.text: I had no idea anyone beyond their ranks was infected. You have my sincere sympathies.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: This magic you mentioned - it isn't normal for these parasites?

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I'm not entirely sure - but I'll take all the help I can get.

214.speaker: Halsin
214.text: Hmm. Sometimes a mysterious cure is worse than the disease.

169.speaker: Halsin
169.text: I may be able to help you find a more definitive solution to your problem.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

106.speaker: Halsin
106.text: Don't be coy - I can sense the imbalance in you. Now let me confirm it, so I can be certain of what we're dealing with...
